channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How does avian flu affect your breakfast; NATO solemnly celebrates 75th anniversary
item.description: Cases of bird flu have been found in dairy cattle, but the risk to humans remains low. Ukraine is front and center today as NATO celebrates its 75th anniversary.
item.content:encoded:
Cases of bird flu have been found in dairy cattle, but the risk to humans remains low. Ukraine is front and center today as NATO celebrates its 75th anniversary.

(Image credit: Charlie Neibergall)
item.dc:creator: Mansee Khurana

item.title: A mayor in Ukraine aids his town's few remaining people, as Russia closes in
item.description: Russian attacks have driven out most of Chasiv Yar's residents. NPR accompanies the mayor on a routine visit to check on those who remain.
item.content:encoded:
Russian attacks have driven out most of Chasiv Yar's residents. NPR accompanies the mayor on a routine visit to check on those who remain.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Virginia lawmakers have voted to raise the marriage age to 18. Most states haven't
item.description: The bill awaits action by the governor and would bar minors from getting married — something activists say leads to abuses.
item.content:encoded:
The bill awaits action by the governor and would bar minors from getting married — something activists say leads to abuses.

(Image credit: Shaban Athuman)
item.dc:creator: Jahd Khalil

item.title: DOJ takes a stand against war crimes in Ukraine. In Gaza war, it's been nearly silent
item.description: The Justice Department has taken an active — and public --stand against alleged Russian war crimes in Ukraine. But it's been nearly silent on possible war crimes in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.content:encoded:
The Justice Department has taken an active — and public --stand against alleged Russian war crimes in Ukraine. But it's been nearly silent on possible war crimes in the Israel-Hamas war.

(Image credit: Samuel Corum)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Concrete structures meant to protect Baltimore bridge appear unchanged for decades
item.description: Experts said if the Key Bridge had been fitted with more robust collision-prevention structures, the collapse might have been avoided. Records indicate the protections weren't significantly altered.
item.content:encoded: Experts said if the Key Bridge had been fitted with more robust collision-prevention structures, the collapse might have been avoided. Records indicate the protections weren't significantly altered.
item.dc:creator: Chiara Eisner

item.title: California colleges provide abortion pills but many fail to make students aware
item.description: Despite a law mandating that they offer the pills, many campus health clinics don't publicize that they have them, leaving students struggling to track them down off-campus.
item.content:encoded: Despite a law mandating that they offer the pills, many campus health clinics don't publicize that they have them, leaving students struggling to track them down off-campus.
item.dc:creator: Adolfo Guzman-Lopez

item.title: Taiwan emerges remarkably unscathed after massive earthquake
item.description: The day after what was the worst quake to hit the Asian island in a quarter century, most residents cannot stop talking about how much worse it could have been.
item.content:encoded:
The day after what was the worst quake to hit the Asian island in a quarter century, most residents cannot stop talking about how much worse it could have been.

(Image credit: ChiangYing-ying)
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: What to know about the risks of the bird flu outbreak
item.description: Cattle are getting sick with H5N1, and one person got sick in Texas. How bad could this be for dairy farms? Could it spread among people? Here's what scientists are learning.
item.content:encoded:
Cattle are getting sick with H5N1, and one person got sick in Texas. How bad could this be for dairy farms? Could it spread among people? Here's what scientists are learning.

(Image credit: Charlie Neibergall)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: These twin brothers are identical, but their autism isn't
item.description: Sam and John Fetters are identical twins with autism. But Sam is in college, while John still struggles to form sentences. Their experience may shed light on the disorder's mix of nature and nurture.
item.content:encoded: Sam and John Fetters are identical twins with autism. But Sam is in college, while John still struggles to form sentences. Their experience may shed light on the disorder's mix of nature and nurture.
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: Powerball jackpot jumps to $1.23 billion after another drawing without a big winner
item.description: The jackpot, which now ranks as the eighth-largest in U.S. lottery history, has been growing for more than three months, reflecting the long odds of 1 in 292.2 million of winning the top prize.
item.content:encoded:
The jackpot, which now ranks as the eighth-largest in U.S. lottery history, has been growing for more than three months, reflecting the long odds of 1 in 292.2 million of winning the top prize.

(Image credit: Mike Stewart)
